intro: Ocimum stirbeyi, commonly known as the Ethiopian basil, is a species of flowering plant in the Lamiaceae family. It is native to Ethiopia and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb, similar to other basil species. Ocimum stirbeyi is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in arid conditions.
